definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To form something by passing lengths or strands of material over and under one another.
examples: This loom weaves yarn into sweaters.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To spin a cocoon or a web .
examples: Spiders weave beautiful but deadly webs.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To unite by close connection or intermixture .
( transitive ) To compose creatively and intricately ; to fabricate .
examples: to weave the plot of a story

main_definition: ( transitive ) To form something by passing lengths or strands of material over and under one another.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To spin a cocoon or a web .
( transitive ) To unite by close connection or intermixture .
( transitive ) To compose creatively and intricately ; to fabricate .

definitions.definition: To move by turning and twisting .
examples: The drunk weaved into another bar.

definitions.definition: To make (a path or way) by winding in and out or from side to side.
examples: The ambulance weaved its way through the heavy traffic.

definitions.definition: To move the head back and forth in a stereotyped pattern, typically as a symptom of stress.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move by turning and twisting .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To make (a path or way) by winding in and out or from side to side.
( intransitive , of an animal ) To move the head back and forth in a stereotyped pattern, typically as a symptom of stress.
